name: Mara Intrepids Club

reviews.text: Stayed at the Intrepids end of July with the family and had a great time.
reviews.title: Fantastic Safari, great camp

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were picked up at the nearby airport by John. He was our safari driver/guide throughout the stay. He was great, made sure we got to see everything we wanted and has very good knowledge on the animals and the area. We will never forget our dash across the Mara to see the black Rhino. We hope he is still there when we next visit as we will be asking for him.
reviews.title: excellent stay

reviews.text: We stayed in 2 tents near each other, rooms are great. Good beds and hot water and electricity during most of the day. Our room maid kept the tents clean. Small hiccup one morning when we had no water but this was addressed by the time we got back from safari
reviews.title: Perfectly situated for game drives

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food at the restraurant was excellent. Chef made a point of coming out to speak to everyone. Another special touch was that we had the same waiter throughout the stay. Julius was great fun. True professional and always having a laugh and a joke with us. This was a wedding anniversary trip for us and on our first evening the hotel gave us a great surprise. All the cooks and waiters came out of the kitchen singing swahili songs and had a big cake with candles. My wife was almost in tears.
reviews.title: mara intrepids is the best camp in the mara.

reviews.text: Safari was breathtaking, thanks to John we managed to see a sunrise on the Mara, the big 5, a leopard kill, a hippo fight and alot more. Some photos on this review. We had the car to ourselves as there was 4 of us, I think this really helped us and John. I hope the management team look to continue to do this so families are together and the safari can be flexible and suited to that family. i.e. not sharing with other people
reviews.title: Fantastic, wonderful place

reviews.text: When we first walked into our "tent" I believe my first words were, "I'm not leaving". I felt the same way at the end of our stay. The accommodations were excellent, the highest quality of any on our trip. Our "tent" was situated close to the river; the only downside to that is at night the animals can be a bit loud at times, especially the hippos. No way I was going to go outside in the middle of the night and tell the hippos to keep the noise down!
reviews.title: "I'm Not Leaving"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hot water and electricity: neither are "full time" however they're timed so that they you would be hard pressed to notice that they're not full time. And the hot water can be heated up for you at any time with 30 minutes notice. There is wifi in the reception area though at times it can be agonizingly slow. The grounds are beautiful and extremely well maintained.
reviews.title: Our tented second home

reviews.text: The food was very good. Lunch is a buffet that always included some type of specialty food that was made to order on a grill or something similar. Lunch, when we were there, was served on the patio which was very pleasant (they will also send box lunches out with you on game drives if you prefer). Dinner was served in the open-air thatched roofed dining hall. Dinner is a multi-course event and was generally pretty good. The same server takes care of you for all meals.
reviews.title: Disappointing honeymoon stay

reviews.text: Our guide was Dennis and he was excellent. Very personable and great at finding the wildlife. He was very flexible about the hours we spent out on our drives. Our "group" was two couples so we had the vehicle to ourselves and Dennis was more than happy to tailor our drives to whatever we wanted to do.
reviews.title: Great accommodation, excellent staff. Best place for game viewing

reviews.text: We were given the option of making three drives a day but instead opted for a long morning drive (instead of two short drives). I highly recommend this as it gives you time to really get out and explore and go further afield without constantly having to plan around going back to the camp. Again, Dennis was great because he was not a "clock watcher"; there was never the feeling of "well, our time's up so we better head back". If we were in the middle of something we stayed until we saw what was to be seen. If you do a long morning drive the camp will prepare you a lunch to take with you; it's not a great boxed lunch but it's adequate.
reviews.title: Lovely experience.

reviews.text: We stayed two nights with our grandson as well as at 6 other lodges in Kenya and Tanzania. Mara Intrepids was the best experience of all. It is in the midst of a superb game viewing area. Sightings start as soon as one leaves and continue all day. We saw several animals that we did not see anywhere else. We also got better views of many animals we saw elsewhere.
reviews.title: Close to perfection

reviews.text: Now to camp itself. Luxurious tents with all amenities.The best food we had while on safaris. Wonderful dinners. But don't miss the wonderful breakfast crepes with carmelized sugar.
reviews.title: The best guide!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were friendly,very helpful and more than willing to make an extra effort. One noticed i was n't feeling well and arranged for the medic to see me.The medic quickly recognized my unfavorable reaction to my malaria medication and saved me much misery by switching to another.
reviews.title: Bravo Intrepids!
Excellent location, camp and staff!
reviews.text: All in all, an exceptional experience I wholeheartedly recommend.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were so thrilled with Mara Intrepid! We booked last minute and had an excellent experience from the questions that were answered promptly when booking to the staff member who stayed with us until we were safely on the plane back to Nairobi. The staff were all exceptional, from check in to dining to room steward to Anna the best masseuse and John, the most wonderful guide. John really made the trip. We spent about 17 hours on game drives on our two night, three days of safari. John is extremely knowledgeable about the wildlife and knows the area so well. He is Maasai and was happy share his knowledge and answer our millions of questions about the animals and the Maasai people. The landscape is so vast, with so many animals! We enjoyed every minute. He is very thoughtful and passed out Maasai blankets on the chilly mornings. He is also a gifted photographer. He made sure we were well positioned to get the best photos possible. The location in the middle of the Mara was also ideal. The guides all work together to share locations and maximize the animal sightings.
reviews.title: Great tented camp

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed a week at the Mara Intrepids at the beginning of a two-week visit to Kenya. None of the properties that followed this stay, while they were wonderful in their own way, even came close to the Mara Intrepids. The staff is absolutely attentive to every detail, accommodating in the extreme, and just plain lovely people. I have never felt so at home so quickly. The food was excellent, our "tent", situated on the banks of the Talek River, was roomy, beautifully appointed, and comfortable. In fact, the entire experience was so far beyond my expectations that I may be completely spoiled for staying anywhere else on future trips.
reviews.title: Mara Intrepids

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was at Mara Intrepids tented camp about ten years ago, and I planned to do some camp hopping this year and chose four camps on the Mara. One was Mara Intrepids, which I loved just as much as then. I like it in particular because in August, it still has the long grass - not the short cropped yellowing grass. We had the best guide we've ever had -- Joseph, a Kikuyu (there are 2 Josephs there) -- and we saw a leopard in the broad daylight, a caracal, a wildebeast crossing, everything. Joseph was such a wonderful guide, gentle, quiet, and extremely intelligent and informative. The food was better here than at some of the other camps we've stayed at over the years, and they made the most delicious thin crepes for breakfast. The bed in the tent had a real mattress on it (unlike Governor's and Little Governor's, which seemed like just a piece of foam), and everything was as it should be. I will definitely go back to Mara Intrepids in the future.
reviews.title: Excellent experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would like to say JAMBO to all our friends that we have made at Mara Intrepids last week, especially Matthew our guide. If you are looking for somewhere to stay in Masai Mara for a safari, this is the place. We have just returned from a four night stay at this camp and it was totally amazing. We have stayed in the Masai Mara before and Mara Intrepids Camp is by far the best in every way.
reviews.title: MARA INTREPIDS - EXCELLENT!!

reviews.text: The camp is lovely, right on the Talek River. The tents are pure luxury and it was lovely to find a warm hot water bottle in your bed at night and also to be woken with tea/coffee or hot chocolate and biscuits before your morning game drive. The location is perfect for seeing all the animals.
reviews.title: Amazing!!!!

reviews.text: The food at the restaurant again was fantastic, with plenty of choice but the highlight was the picnic breakfast on the Mara River which we chose to have twice during our stay. It was also nice to have the same waiter and Nelson was really friendly and looked after us during our stay.
reviews.title: Fantastic luxury family safari in the heart of the Masai Mara

aka: Mara Intrepids Club Hotel Maasai Mara National Reserve
